result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan D Kuchar was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$5000-$10,000, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Restutitution disputed, Held Open.  To Be Determined 11-04-2015.

AS OF 11/04/2015: Restitution was set at ZERO.

Cost Paid In Full.
DNA Surcharge cash bail applied, the balance to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Extradition Cost of $1,271.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
No contact with:  J&L Fiber and it's employees and the Co-Defendant's.
DNA Sample if not yet provided and Pay Surcharge.

Case #15CF914 was Dismissed and Read into Case #15CF16.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Prison

Defendant Ryan D Kuchar in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for restitution hearing. State has not heard anything from the victims. Defense counsel is requesting that restitutition be set at zero. Court grants.  New JOC to be completed.
Restitution hearing at 11-04-2015 03:00 pm

Defendant Ryan D Kuchar in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.   Stephen Joseph Centinario appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to the amended information charge count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of the amended charge.  Case # 15CF914 is dismissed and read in.  State gives recommendations, victims were notified of today's hearing.  Attorney Menden makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  Attorney Menden moves for bail posted to be returned to the poster instead of paying costs.   

The Court Orders the Following: Ct#1
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:  

3 Years Imprisonment (Credit - 25 days )
1 1/2 Years of Initial Confinement
1 1/2 Years of Extended Supervision
Term of Probation: 3 Years
Conditions of Probation:
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
No contact with J&L Fiber and its employees, and the defendants co-defendants.  .
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided  and pay surcharge
Extradition costs:  $1271.00 to be paid to Waukesha County DA's office
Restitution:  disputed, held open
Costs: $278.00 cashbail to be applied
DNA Surcharge:  $250.00 partial cashbail to be applied
Court orders 1/2 of bail be applied to court costs, the other 1/2 to be returned to the poster.
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
Condition Time: 60 days jail stayed for use of agent
Felony warnings, immigration warnings,  voting rights and firearms warnings given.  
Restitution hearing scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
